intro: Lepechiniella, commonly known as the narrow-leaved germander, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Lamiaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly in regions such as South Africa and Namibia. The plants typically have small, narrow leaves and produce clusters of small, tubular flowers. They are often found in rocky or sandy soils and are adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Lepechiniella species are valued for their ornamental appeal and are sometimes used in traditional medicine.
